Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect Whistleblowers by establishing the Prohibition of Dismissal and Disadvantageous Treatment of Whistleblower, etc. on the ground of Whistleblowing, and the measures to be taken by business operators and administrative organs with regard to Whistleblowing, and to comply with the provisions of laws and regulations concerning the protection of the lives, bodies, property and other interests of citizens, thereby contributing to the stabilization of the lives of the citizens and the sound development of the social and economic welfare.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
The term "Whistleblowing" as used in this Act means a business operator (meaning a juridical person or other organization or an individual operating a business) provided for in each of the following items, without the purpose of acquiring a wrongful gain, causing injury to others, or for any other wrongful purpose: (the same shall apply hereinafter) (hereinafter referred to as the "Service Recipient"), or, in cases where the officer engages in the business of the Service Recipient, the officer, accounting advisor, company auditor, director, inspector, or liquidator of the juridical person, and any other person who engages in such business shall be referred to as laws and regulations (meaning laws and orders based on laws and regulations). (hereinafter the same shall apply): a person (excluding an accounting auditor) engaged in the management of a juridical person under its provisions; The same shall apply hereinafter), employees, agents, or any other persons who are to be notified that a Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur, a person whom the Service Provider or said Service Provider has designated in advance (hereinafter referred to as the "Service Provider, etc."), or a disposition (meaning an order, rescission or any other act in exercising public authority) with regard to said Reportable Fact. the same shall apply hereinafter) or Recommendation, etc. (meaning a recommendation or any other act which is not equivalent to a disposition). The same shall apply hereinafter): An Administrative Organ that has the authority to do so, or a person designated in advance by the Administrative Organ (referred to as an "Administrative Organ, etc." in item (ii) of the following Article and item (ii) of Article 6), or a person who is found to be necessary to report the Reportable Fact to such person in order to prevent the occurrence of the Reportable Fact or the increase of the damage caused by such fact (including a person who is likely to suffer or suffer damage from the Reportable Fact, and excluding a person who is likely to harm the competitive position of the Service Recipient or any other legitimate interests. The same shall apply in item (iii) of the following Article and item (iii) of Article 6).

(i) Worker (meaning a worker as prescribed in Article 9 of the Labor Standards Act (Act No. 49 of 1947); The same shall apply hereinafter) or a person who was a worker A business operator who employed the said worker or a person who was a worker by himself/herself or who employed the said worker himself/herself within one year prior to the date of the said notification (excluding the business operator prescribed in the following item)

(ii) Dispatched Workers (Act for Securing the Proper Operation of Worker Dispatching Undertakings and Protection, etc. of Dispatched Workers (Act No. 88 of 1985); This shall mean a Dispatched Worker as prescribed in item (ii) of Article 2 of the Worker Dispatching Act" in Article 4. the same shall apply hereinafter) or a person who was a Dispatched Worker: Worker Dispatching (meaning the Worker Dispatching prescribed in item (i) of the same Article) pertaining to said Dispatched Worker or a person who was a Dispatched Worker the same shall apply in Article 4 and Article 5, paragraph (2)) a business operator who has received the provision of services or who had received such notification within one year prior to the date of said notification

(iii) In the case where a business operator prescribed in the preceding two items is or was engaged in a business based on a contract or other contract with another business operator, a worker or a worker who was engaged in the said business or was a dispatched worker or a dispatched worker who was engaged in the said business within one year prior to the date of the said notification: the said other business operator

(iv) Officers: The following business operators:

A A business operator who has the officer perform his/her duties

In the case where a business operator listed in b a engages in business based on a contract or other contract with another business operator, said other business operator in the case where said officer engages in said business

(2) The term "Whistleblower" as used in this Act means a person who has made Whistleblowing.

(3) The term "Reportable Fact" as used in this Act means any of the following facts:

(i) Acts listed in the appended table as those related to the protection of the lives or bodies of individuals, the protection of the interests of consumers, the preservation of the environment, the maintenance of fair competition, and other protection of the lives, bodies, property and other interests of citizens (including orders based on these Acts); the facts of the criminal act prescribed in this paragraph) or the facts which are the grounds for the non-penal fine prescribed in this Act and the Acts listed in the same table

(ii) In the case where the violation of a disposition pursuant to the provisions of an Act listed in the appended table becomes a fact listed in the preceding item, the fact that is the reason for said disposition (including the fact that is the reason for said other disposition or recommendation, etc. in the case where the fact that is the reason for said disposition violates another disposition pursuant to the provisions of an Act listed in the same table or does not follow the recommendation, etc.).

(4) The term "Administrative Organ" as used in this Act means the following organs:

(i) The Cabinet Office, the Imperial Household Agency, organs prescribed in Article 49, paragraph (1) or paragraph (2) of the Act for Establishment of the Cabinet Office (Act No. 89 of 1999), the Digital Agency, organs prescribed in Article 3, paragraph (2) of the National Government Organization Act (Act No. 120 of 1948), organs under the jurisdiction of the Cabinet or organs established under these Acts, or officials who are legally permitted to exercise their authority independently

(ii) Organs of local public entities (excluding assemblies)

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: A business operator prescribed in item (ii) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 (limited to one who receives the provision of Worker Dispatching services pertaining to said Dispatched Worker) The cancelation of a worker dispatch contract (which means a worker dispatch contract prescribed in paragraph 1 of Article 2 of the Worker Dispatching Act) by a business operator prescribed in paragraph 1 of Article 2 on the grounds that a Whistleblower who is a Dispatched Worker working under the direction and order of paragraph 2 of the following Article has made Whistleblowing as prescribed in the items of the preceding Article shall be void.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
In addition to what is provided for in Article 3, the business operator provided for in item (i) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 shall not give any disadvantageous treatment such as demotion, reduction of pay, failure to pay a retirement allowance or any other treatment to the Whistleblower who is or was used by the business operator on the grounds that such Whistleblower has made Whistleblowing as provided for in each item of Article 3.

(2) In addition to what is provided for in the preceding Article, the business operator provided for in item (ii) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 shall not request the Whistleblower to change the Dispatched Workers to the business operator carrying out the Worker Dispatching pertaining to the Whistleblower concerned on the grounds that the Whistleblower is a Dispatched Worker working under the direction and order has made Whistleblowing as provided for in each item of Article 3, or shall not otherwise treat the Whistleblower disadvantageously.

(3) Business operators provided for in item (iv) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 (limited to business operators provided for in a of the same item). The same shall apply in the following Article and in paragraph 4 of Article 8) shall not reduce the amount of remuneration or otherwise treat any disadvantageous Whistleblower (except for dismissal) on the grounds that the Whistleblower who is or was made to perform his/her duties has made Whistleblowing as provided for in each item of the following Article.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
In the event that a Whistleblower is dismissed from the business operator provided for in item (iv) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 on the basis of Whistleblowing provided for in each of the following items in the case listed in the relevant item, he/she may claim damages arising from the dismissal from such business operator:

(i) In the case where the Reportable Fact occurs or is about to occur: Whistleblowing to the Service Provider, etc.

(ii) In any of the following cases: Whistleblowing to an Administrative Organ, etc. that has the authority to make a disposition or recommendation, etc. concerning the Reportable Fact:

A Investigation and Rectification Measures (which means the measures necessary for the investigation of the Reportable Facts and the rectification of the Reportable Facts with the same care as a prudent manager; In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred, or is about to occur, despite the efforts made to take the a in the next item)

B There are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur, and there is a probable cause to believe that there is a danger to the life or body of an individual or that there is a imminent danger of the occurrence or occurrence of damage to an individual's property (excluding those in the case of conducting a business)

(iii) In the case of falling under any of the following: Whistleblowing to a person who is found to be necessary to report the Reportable Fact to said person in order to prevent the occurrence or increase of damage caused by said notification

A Cases where there are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur, and where any of the following applies, despite efforts to take corrective measures to rectify the investigation

1. In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that Whistleblowing provided for in the preceding two items would result in dismissal, reduction of remuneration or other disadvantageous treatment.

2. In the case where there are reasonable grounds to believe that Whistleblowing provided for in item (i) would destroy evidence pertaining to the Reportable Fact, forge or be likely to be altered.

3. In the case where the Service Provider requests that the Whistleblower should not provide the Whistleblowing provided for in the preceding two items without justifiable grounds

B There are reasonable grounds to believe that the Reportable Fact has occurred or is about to occur, and there is a probable cause to believe that there is a danger to the life or body of an individual or that there is a imminent danger of the occurrence or occurrence of damage to an individual's property (excluding those in the case of conducting a business)

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The business operators provided for in each item of Paragraph 1 of Article 2 may not demand compensation from Whistleblower who made Whistleblowing on the grounds that he/she suffered damages by Whistleblowing provided for in each item of Article 3 and each item of the preceding Article.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
The provisions of Articles 3 to 3 inclusive shall not preclude the application of the provisions of other laws and regulations that prohibit dismissal or other disadvantageous treatment of persons listed in each item of Article 2, paragraph (1) on the grounds that they have made a report pertaining to the Reportable Fact.

(2) The provision of Article 3 shall not preclude the application of the provision of Article 16 of the Labor Contract Act (Act No. 128 of 2007).

(3) The provision of paragraph (1) of Article 5 shall not preclude the application of the provisions of Articles 14 and 15 of the Labor Contract Act.

(4) The provisions of Article 6 shall not preclude the application of the provisions of other laws and regulations to the effect that a person who has been dismissed from an officer by a business operator provided for in Article 2, paragraph (1), item (iv) on the grounds that he/she has made a report pertaining to the Reportable Fact may claim compensation for damages caused by his/her dismissal from said business operator.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: With regard to dismissal and other disadvantageous treatment of national public officers of the regular service, court officials subject to the Act on Temporary Measures for Court Officials (Act No. 299 of 1951), Diet officials subject to the Act on Special Measures for National Diet Officials (Act No. 85 of 1947), members of the Self-Defense Forces Act (Act No. 165 of 1947) and local public officers of the regular service (hereinafter referred to as "national public officers, etc. of the regular service" in this Article), notwithstanding the provisions of Articles 3 to 5 to 5 inclusive, the National Public Service Act (Act No. 12222 of 199447). The provisions of the Act on Temporary Measures for Court Officials, the Diet Staff Act, the Self-Defense Forces Act, and the Local Public Service Act (Act No. 261 of 1950) shall apply mutatis mutandis. In this case, the employer provided for in item (i) of paragraph (1) of Article 2 shall apply the provisions of these Acts so as not to be discharged or otherwise disadvantaged from the national public officers, etc. of the regular service on the basis of Whistleblowing provided for in each item of Article 3.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: Any person who makes Whistleblowing as provided for in each item of Article 3 and each item of Article 6 shall endeavor not to harm the legitimate interests or public interests of others.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
The employer shall specify a person (referred to as "Whistleblower Service Person" in the following Article) who is to receive Whistleblowing as provided for in Item (i) of Article 3 and Item (i) of Article 6, to investigate the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing, and to be engaged in the business of taking necessary measures to rectify such fact (referred to as "Whistleblowing Service" in the following Article).

(2) In addition to what is provided for in the preceding paragraph, the employer shall, in order to protect Whistleblowers and to comply with the provisions of laws and regulations relating to the protection of the lives, bodies, property and other interests of citizens by making use of the contents of Whistleblowing, establish a system necessary to respond appropriately to the Whistleblowing as provided for in item (i) of Article 3 and item (i) of Article 6 and take other necessary measures.

(3) For the employer who has not more than 300 full-time workers, the term "unless stipulated" in paragraph (1) shall be deemed to be replaced with "endeavor to fix," and the term "if omitted" in the preceding paragraph shall be deemed to be replaced with "if stipulated."

(4) With regard to the measures to be taken by a business operator pursuant to the provisions of paragraphs (1) and (2) (including the cases where these provisions are applied by replacing certain terms pursuant to the provisions of the preceding paragraph), the Prime Minister shall provide the necessary guidelines for the appropriate and effective implementation of such measures (hereinafter simply referred to as the "Guidelines" in this Article).

(5) When the Prime Minister intends to establish the Guidelines, he/she shall hear the opinions of the Consumer Commission in advance.

(6) When the Prime Minister has established the Guidelines, he/she shall publicize them without delay.

(7) The provisions of the preceding two paragraphs shall apply mutatis mutandis to changes to the guidelines.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: No person who is or was formerly a Whistleblower Handling Business Operator shall, without justifiable grounds, divulge any matters which he/she has learned with regard to the Whistleblowing Response Business that will specify the Whistleblower.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
In the event that Whistleblower receives Whistleblowing as provided for in Item 2 of Article 3 and Item 2 of Article 6, the Administrative Organ having the authority to make Dispositions or Recommendations, etc. with respect to the Reportable Fact shall conduct the necessary investigation, and if it finds that the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing exists, it shall take measures based on laws and regulations or other appropriate measures.

(2) An Administrative Organ (excluding officials prescribed in Article 2, paragraph 4, item 1) having the authority to make Dispositions or Recommendations on Reportable Facts shall, in order to ensure the appropriate implementation of the measures prescribed in the preceding paragraph, establish a system necessary for responding appropriately to Whistleblowing as prescribed in Article 3, item 2 and Article 6, item 2 and take other necessary measures.

(3) Notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs, the Code of Criminal Procedure (Act No. 131 of 1948) shall apply to the investigation and prosecution of a crime in the case where the Whistleblowing provided for in paragraph (1) contains the facts of the criminal act provided for in Article 2, paragraph (3), item (i).

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: In the event that Whistleblowing under paragraph 1 of the preceding Article is made by mistake to an Administrative Organ that does not have the authority to make a Disposition or Recommendation, etc. on the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing, said Administrative Organ shall instruct said Administrative Organ that has the authority to make a Disposition or Recommendation, etc. on the Reportable Fact pertaining to said Whistleblowing.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The Prime Minister may, when he/she finds it necessary in relation to the enforcement of the provisions of Article 11, paragraphs (1) and (2) (including the cases where these provisions are applied by replacing certain terms pursuant to the provisions of paragraph (3) of the same Article), request a business operator to make a report or give advice, guidance or recommendation to the business operator.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The Prime Minister may, when he/she has made a recommendation under the provision of the preceding Article to an Enterprise in violation of the provisions of Article 11, paragraph (1) and paragraph (2), and when the person who has received such recommendation has failed to follow such recommendation, make public the fact.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The Prime Minister may make inquiries to or request cooperation from relevant administrative organs with regard to the affairs under the provisions of this Act.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The Prime Minister shall endeavor to collect, organize and provide information on the status of Whistleblowers and other information that will contribute to the protection of Whistleblowers and the observance of the provisions of laws and regulations relating to the protection of the lives, bodies, property and other interests of citizens through the use of the contents of Whistleblowing.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The Prime Minister shall delegate his/her authority under this Act (excluding that specified by a Cabinet Order) to the Secretary-General of the Consumer Affairs Agency.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: The provisions of Article 15 and Article 16 shall not apply to the State and local public entities.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: Any person who has divulged the matters prescribed in Article 12 in violation of the provisions of the same Article shall be punished by a fine of not more than three hundred thousand yen.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content: Any person who fails to make a report pursuant to the provisions of Article 15 or who makes a false report shall be punished by a non-penal fine of not more than 200,000 yen.

Title: Whistleblower Protection Act
Content:
(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding two years from the day of promulgation, and shall apply to Whistleblowing made after the enforcement of this Act.

(Review)

Article 2 Approximately five years after this Act comes into effect, the government shall review the state of enforcement of this Act, and shall take necessary measures based on the results thereof.

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 66 of June 14, 2006) (Extract)

This Act shall come into effect as from the day of enforcement of the Act for Revision of the Securities and Exchange Act 2006.

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding three months from the day of promulgation.

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 27 of April 6, 2002) (Extract)

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding six months from the day of promulgation.

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 70 of June 28, 2003) (Extract)

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding two years from the day of promulgation.

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 70 of June 23, 2007) (Extract)

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding one year from the day of promulgation.

(Transitional Measures Concerning Penal Provisions)

Article 7 With regard to the application of penal provisions to acts committed prior to the enforcement of this Act, the provisions then in force shall remain applicable

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 51 of June 12, 1937) (Extract)

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into force as from the date specified by a Cabinet Order within a period not exceeding two years from the day of promulgation. However, the provisions of Article 3 and Article 4 of the Supplementary Provisions shall come into effect as from the date of promulgation.

(Transitional Measures)

Article 2 The provisions of the Whistleblower Protection Act revised by this Act (hereinafter referred to as the "New Act") shall apply to Whistleblowing provided for in Article 2, paragraph 1 of the New Act which is made after the enforcement of this Act, and with regard to Whistleblowing provided for in Article 2, paragraph 1 of the Whistleblower Protection Act prior to the revision by this Act which was made before the enforcement of this Act, the provisions then in force shall remain applicable.

Article 3 The Prime Minister may, even prior to the enforcement of this Act, provide for guidelines on measures to be taken by business operators pursuant to the provisions of Article 11, paragraphs (4) to (7) inclusive of the New Act.

(2) The guidelines provided for in the preceding paragraph shall be deemed to have been provided for in Article 11, paragraph (4) of the New Act as of the date of enforcement of this Act.

(Delegation to Cabinet Order)

Article 4 In addition to what is provided for in the preceding two Articles, transitional measures necessary for the enforcement of this Act shall be specified by a Cabinet Order.

(Review)

Article 5 Approximately three years after this Act comes into effect, the government shall review the state of measures for correction of adverse treatment to Whistleblowers prescribed in Article 2, paragraph (2) of the New Act on the grounds that Whistleblowing has been made as prescribed in paragraph (1) of the same Article, the handling of claims in court proceedings, and other provisions of the New Act, and shall take necessary measures based on the results of the review.

Supplementary Provisions (Act No. 36 of May 19, 1938) (Extract)

(Effective Date)

Article 1 This Act shall come into effect as from September 1, 1931. However, the provisions of Article 60 of the Supplementary Provisions shall come into effect as from the date of promulgation.

(Transitional Measures Concerning Dispositions, etc.)

Article 57 Before this Act comes into effect, each Act prior to its revision by this Act (including orders issued thereunder). Dispositions such as Dispositions such as Dispositions rendered by previous state organs pursuant to the provisions of this Article and the following Article referred to as "Old Laws and Regulations" shall, in addition to those otherwise provided for by laws and regulations, be rendered to the respective Acts revised by this Act (including orders issued thereunder) after the enforcement of this Act. It shall be deemed to be a Disposition of Authorization, etc. or any other act issued by a corresponding state organ pursuant to the corresponding provisions of this Article and the following Article referred to as "New Laws and Regulations".

(2) Applications, notifications and other acts that have been filed or made to a state organ prior to the enforcement of this Act pursuant to the provisions of the old laws and regulations shall be deemed, after the enforcement of this Act, to be applications, notifications and other acts that have been filed or made to a state organ prior to the enforcement of this Act pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the new laws and regulations, except as otherwise provided by laws and regulations.

(3) With regard to matters for which an application, notification, or other procedures must be filed with an organ of the previous state pursuant to the provisions of the old laws and regulations prior to the enforcement of this Act, for which the procedure has not been implemented with an organ of the previous state prior to the date of enforcement of this Act, the provisions of the new laws and regulations shall apply, after the enforcement of this Act, by deeming that such procedures have not been implemented with an organ of the corresponding state pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the new laws and regulations, except as otherwise provided by laws and regulations.

(Transitional Measures Concerning Effect of Order)

Article 58 The Cabinet Office Ordinance provided for in Article 7, paragraph (3) of the Act for Establishment of the Cabinet Office or the Ministerial Ordinance provided for in Article 12, paragraph (1) of the National Government Organization Act issued pursuant to the provisions of the Old Acts shall, after the enforcement of this Act, have the effect as the corresponding Digital Agency Ordinance provided for in Article 7, paragraph (3) or the corresponding Ministerial Ordinance provided for in Article 12, paragraph (1) of the National Government Organization Act issued pursuant to the corresponding provisions of the New Laws and Regulations.

(Delegation to Cabinet Order)

Article 60 In addition to what is provided for in Article 15, Article 16, Article 51, and the preceding three Articles of the Supplementary Provisions, any necessary transitional measures for the enforcement of this Act (including transitional measures concerning penal provisions) shall be specified by a Cabinet Order.
